verses.roman:
tomāra nāma śuni' rājā ānandita haila
āsana haite uṭhi' more āliṅgana kaila

synonyms: tomāra—Your; nāma—name; śuni'—hearing; rājā—the King; ānandita—very much pleased; haila—became; āsana haite—from his throne; uṭhi'—standing; more—me; āliṅgana kaila—embraced.
translation: "When I submitted this proposal, the King immediately became very much pleased upon hearing Your name. Indeed, he instantly arose from his throne and embraced me.
